moves.2. Nf3: Threatens my pawn with his knight.
moves.3. Bb5: Threatens my knight that is protecting my pawn.
moves.3... Bd6: I protect with the bishop. Now, I would protect with the pawn.
moves.4... a6: I threaten the bishop with my pawn.
moves.5... Nf6: I open up my other knight, I am now in a castling position.
moves.7... Bb4: I threaten with my bishop, pinning the knight to the king.
moves.11. Re1: Doesn't really do anything. This might be good in the toward the end.
moves.11... Re8: I copy, because I don't see anything I can do. I'm waiting for an opportunity.
moves.12. Nh4: Looking to threaten my pawn after Nf5.
moves.13... Qf6: I protect the pawn with my queen.
moves.14. Qd2: Uh-oh, double threat against my one protecter.
moves.14... h5: I move out of the way.
moves.16. Bxf7: Takes the pawn. Not a good move. Very risky.
moves.16... Rf8: I threaten the bishop with my rook.
moves.17. Nf5+: Forced to retreat or die, but I still get the bishop.
moves.18. Nh6+: Checks me, not doing anything, though.
moves.19. f3: A bit weird, opens up the king to a diagonal.
moves.19... d6: I open up the line for my bishop.
moves.20. a3: Pushes up a pawn. This doesn't do anything.
moves.21. Kf1: The king moves out of the way, smart.
moves.22. Nf5: I will still receive a pawn.
moves.22... Bxf5: I take the knight with my bishop, obviously.
moves.24. Re4: Not a good move. Ng5, threatens the rook and mate after Nxf3.
moves.25... Nxf3: At a glance one would think. 'Huh? sacrifice a knight for a pawn. Maybe they didn't see the pawn on g3'. But if one looked closer…
moves.26. gxf3: Takes the bait. Now mate in 3.
moves.27. Kg1: Forced to move their unless mate in 1 is wanted.
moves.27... Rg6+:
I check with the rook, and my opponent is forced to block with the queen, with would result in checkmate.
My opponent resigns. This team match is still going. I won both my games. Wish my fellow teammate anacronish luck. Please comment. Thank you.
